Then I reopen this pull request to let you guys choose, sorry for the disturbance.\n

In this case, both use cases are valid and the user has to decide, so I think the extra added option makes sense.\n... or we can add -syslog option, change the default to local time and then users with several bitcoind's around the world can syslog to one place to make it easier to correlate. This is the way how other daemons solve this (but there are exceptions).\n
Using anything but UTC for things like this can cause many, many headaches. If the user _really_ wants non-UTC, it's rather trivial to convert everything in the log to it manually.\n

@paveljanik people are already using bitcoind with other logging backends. As I learned the hard way when I tried to fiddle with it, that's what `-printtoconsole` is used for. It prints the log messages to stdout, so it is trivial to make the output - per line - end up in a system log.
